backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no logic.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report linking features to affected files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text map summarizing frontend file purposes for the Tambola app.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles and theme variables defining light/dark color palettes and global styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading the Tambola app root and main TypeScript bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app assembling game state, controls, history, and board layout.
frontend/src/features/tambola/components: UI controls for drawing, undoing, resets with confirmation dialogs, and auto-draw settings.
Displays called numbers in reverse order with scrollable history.
Shows the last drawn number in a styled circular display with completion message.
Renders numbers 1–90 with visual highlighting for called numbers.
frontend/src/features/tambola/storage.ts: Functions for loading, saving, and initializing Tambola game state and auto-draw settings.
frontend/src/features/tambola/types.ts: TypeScript interfaces defining Tambola game state, auto-draw settings, and persisted state.
frontend/src/features/tambola/useTambola: Custom hook managing Tambola game state, number drawing, undo, auto‑draw timers, and persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor based on Internet Identity, refetching dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity auth context, handling login, stored identity loading, clearing, and status tracking.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles plus custom theme variables and a patterned background for the app.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point setting up React Query and Internet Identity provider before rendering the app.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, colors from CSS variables, plugins, and layout settings.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing Tambola app goals, features, architecture notes, and known issues.
